page.title: 03Housing in Wrea Green (p.1)
page.content:
There are lots of different types of houses in the village of Wrea Green. An example of new types of housing is an estate which is full of mock Georgian houses. All these houses have bay windows and their bricks are red, dark brown or sandy in colour.
Around the village green are large detached houses, bungalows, cottages, and terraced houses. There is also a farm overlooking the Green. Some of the class live on housing estates which contain semi-detached houses. These have ten rooms and small gardens.
One boy in the class lives in a large detached house built by his father.
